jV6xrOl6H7v9TU61CmGp1w.text: Great spot.  Met the owners and they make you want to come and frequent this business.  Small restauranteur with 3 other different restaurants out in OR, so NOT a chain.  Design by same people who did Postino's and Culinary Dropout.  Has the right amount of sound management.  Tasty food and fantastic happy hour menu.  Fabulous outdoor bar patio and separate dining patio.  We will be back!

FkttDV7T8tE3o4I1PyDwsQ.text: I was so excited when I heard about this new restaurant opening so close to home.  We ate there last night with our adult children.  The service was great--super attentive and quick service.  The decor is very attractive.  But our food was not good.  My son's fried chicken was so mushy that he was afraid it was not cooked all the way through, and it was very salty.  My fish taco had very little fish in it, which was also soggy with little flavor.  One daughter thought her club sandwich was okay, but not exciting, and our other daughter said her ribs were okay.  Same with Hubby's burger.  All the fries were served cold!  I would have said something to the server, but my kids get embarrassed, lol. On top of all that, it was SO LOUD that we could barely hear each other. I guess we'll keep trekking to Phoenix to Angel Trumpet Ale House and to Gilbert to Wilderness Brewing, where the food and beers are tasty and a fair price.

DnsI9QGs_IYgMCJgH2O1WA.text: A lot of beer on tap.  If you are a beer lover go here.  The food wasn't too bad either.  This is your typical fancy (high end) pub.  We started with the nachos, which were great.  I moved on to the french dip which didn't disappoint.

gbZ5JFi7WKPLa3TOj5ejTw.text: The food was excellent with a nice selection ranging from salads and apps to burgers and pizza with service that is friendly and fast.  The craft beer selection is great.  Plenty of seating indoors and outdoors with views of the TV's for sports.  The patios are designed for...wait for this...both winter and summer.  Plenty of shade and misters for summer and fire places with ample seating for winter.  The patios are facing east and north respectively.  No WEST facing patios...perfect!

YAcJZbOEjMqJJn9wM45peQ.text: Great restaurant! Scratch kitchen with amazing food and service. Glad to have this now open in Chandler!

-Y22jzoJZeSWoWQsgiTNtw.text: Went for lunch today after seeing a writeup on Facebook. The restaurant environment is really hip and cool. Love that they had varied seating including booths, high tops and regular tables. Decor is super fun. Was greeted by two friendly people who seated us right away in a booth by their open kitchen. The menu of both food, beer and cocktails is vast and impressive. Everyone can find both a beverage and dish to suit their tastes. We ordered the fried chicken sandwich, Cuban and BBQ bacon burger. Server was really great, friendly and accommodating. I can tell they run a tight ship, everything seemed to be well thought out and executed great! The hit was the chicken sandwich. The burger was great and tasty. Cuban was a smidge dry but still totally tasty. Prices are pretty normal. We had 3 entrees and one beer and our bill was $47. Pretty standard. I look forward to visiting again and trying the different entrees and cocktails. Great job guys! Welcome to the neighborhood! I have no complaints. Totally worth the visit.

A8lx09rxXpo-Z5eUGu1WrQ.text: Good happy hour food and drinks! really enjoyed the pretzel and the mac and cheese. Happy hour beer selection was good and would definitely come back again.

fzRjkgahu-IYfh1twBn2qQ.text: I have been to this establishment two times. Both times the gargonzola burger came out raw!! Took forever to get a new order finally the manager came over and I asked him if the waitress had sent him over as she told my party she was going to relate to him and the Chef to put a rush on it! He said he did not know but they had 3 Managers working!! Seems like quite a staff to pay. The rest of my party of 3 had almost finished eating!! I told him just forget my meal I wasn't going to reorder and he never apologized just said well you can walk out anytime the meal is on us!! Not the best customer service for a manager to not try and make amends besides a free meal. Loved the atmosphere so may give it another go round!!

vsKYAS9eXzSzHZgDNUZ-nQ.text: Neat place. Great atmosphere. Food was great. Got the nachos appetizer and it was DElicious! Would definitely recommend.

VZOscHusNdgVBu-xgioY9w.text: If I could give 10 stars I would.  We came here to celebrate my sisters 40th bday.  They went above and beyond to make it special.  They were super organized, efficient and the food and drinks were AMAZING!!!  Can't say enough great things

M39t_jWBypW3ZQ8uLwvhFA.text: Finally a decent place to eat other than your typical mall chain restaurants. We were promptly greeted by a friendly hostess and were seated immediately. The owner came to our table and welcomed us with a short back story of how he and his wife opened the place. Our server was punctual and friendly, while not overbearing. We order the chicken marsala and blackened chicken pasta dishes. Both were outstanding, well prepared, perfect seasoning, and delivered to our table not too fast and not too slow. Overall service was spot-on and the food was delicious. They also have a very extensive brew menu of local favorites and micro brews. The music was good and not too loud (mix of 70's, 80's and 90's), and great ambiance. We'll definitely be back.

1ksJbCJOOvUVA-XP06Kmyg.text: You can literally try a new beer every week for a whole year! Their burgers are amazing and the cheesecake was downright heavenly!!! Plus the ambiance is actually authentic antiques repurposed into funky cool pieces.

eSB1rC3AJguWjxUkvyJdJA.text: Tried this place yesterday with a coworker and I have to say I am impressed, not so much with the blah gray paint on the outside but the inside makes up for it.  The service provided by Adam was excellent and the servings were huge, which would account for the prices.  I had the cheeseburger and my friend had the fried chicken plate.  The cheeseburger was so huge I had to take half of it home but my friend devoured the whole plate.  Both meals were above average and definitely deserves a return trip.

1Onh7uECxtx-uPPUicgDQw.text: We came at 8pm on a Friday night so we were expecting service to be less than stellar being busy. There was a woman, who I believe was a manager of some sort, who was so friendly and picked up slack of waiters. Waited 45 minutes for food and didn't get the appetizer we ordered. I had someone else come by to get refills and when I asked a question on a drink I received a response of "I don't drink alcohol" - a little shocking to not be educated on what you are serving. Our waiter was sub par and I would believe that to be the case even if they were slow. Food and drinks were good. We will definitely come back just looking forward to trying when slower.

MbvkJ8iEqkq4Me5eWd6uoA.text: Great selection of beers. Can't ask for more than that! This is a refreshing new place with a pretty vast selection of food. I like pb&j burgers but I'm not usually one to order them. For some reason I was in the mood for one and this one did not disappoint. It was delicious and a very good size. Super filling. Good fries! And the ranch had something interesting about it. In a good way!

Rcd2j-hJhz15vCxnxlO4Tg.text: One of the most delicious restaurants I've been to in a long time!! Tonight we shared the stuffed salmon, BBQ ribs, and the chicken Marsala. We enjoyed the layered nachos, pretzels with beer cheese, and Ahi Tuna Poke appetizers and the donuts with caramel sauce for dessert. Everything was cooked to perfection and memorable! The open kitchen restaurant has quaint sofa seating, as well as high tops, and a spacious energy filled bar. We will definitely return often.

FEnYO6gIfBUQQQUCyBu-AA.text: Delicious food, terrific service, great beer selection, overall fantastic dining experience!

oAkqJIUZ-a7vzek_tzbbxg.text: Nice atmosphere, decent beer list, clean, great service. We ordered the chicken sandwich, caesar salad, and the pastrami and pretzel bun for lunch. We both had the house cut fries as well. Food was decent. My pretzel bun was soggy by the time I got it and both of our fries tasted like they were made hours ago sitting under a hot lamp. They are hard and not fresh. The manager came over and asked us about the food, we told him what our opinions were and he offered to get us new fries, but we were already done eating at that point. He was very nice and accommodating. I did mention to him the lady at the front handing food off to the runners was poking her bare fingers in burgers and grabbing things to fix on plates while handling checks and other things. It was completely grossed out. He said it was normal for them to do that. Based on the quality of the food, it was over priced and I don't want someone's fingers inside my food. Probably won't return.

ghCmVVsMY7ZMp1dBcsarnw.text: My husband and I dined at Hop on their 4th day of being open. Despite the newness, the staff and kitchen has their act together. We had a great dining experience and even met the owner who spent some time talking to us. The beer selection is extensive and the food is amazing. Many recipes are ones from the owner's momma. We will be back!

OME6TYRmzX-_hKe_mzwamQ.text: This is a great new place in chandler.  With amazing food and drinks. Angel behind the bar is a great bartender and a amazing attitude. I will be returning to this place as much as possible.

NZngPP1XRKbLZehFbeSBaQ.text: We LOVE Hop Social. My parents live nearby so we always go when I'm on that side of town. The chicken pot pie is AMAZING! It is a very nice, modern restaurant with TVs at the bar and an open kitchen.   They have some pretty large tables. We have easily gone with a big group a few times and were seated right away. Their beer selections are great with 52 beers on tap and a few rotating seasonal beers.   We have been impressed with all the food we have tried from the pretzels & cheese and nachos to the spicy tuna roll, stuffed salmon and Kung Pao chicken. Seriously I think we have tried it all  Get the house made donuts, you won't regret it!!

h_b2NPRxwYHQ9zfyPBaiRA.text: Love the pretzels & cheese.  Excellent!  The atmosphere is relaxed & comfortable.  The service is good & the food is pretty good.   I feel it's more of a drinks & app place, but the pretzels & cheese alone are worth the trip.

a_aAqYiyqmS-sqGp5IW6VA.text: This is my first post on Yelp ever. Been using the app for years as I travel frequently and have come to trust the reviews in unfamiliar cities.   Hop Social is (or has been) one of our favorite spots to eat at. Food has always been top notch.   What did not go well is waiting almost an hour for food to hit our table and it was for myself and my younger daughter. No cocktails or appetizers, just two regular menu dinners. The part that makes it tough is NO ONE checked, stopped by, explained delays, nothing. We sat unattended and surrounded by empty tables. This, in my opinion, is one of the worst things any service staff should ever do or allow.   And just to add some more to this waiting game, I also had to wait for someone to come by so I could pay and end this 2.5 hour debacle.  I am going to try and treat this as a "first time shame on you, second time shame on me" type situation but my awareness is up and unfortunately I will be extremely skeptical on my next visit (which will not be any time soon)  Please Hop Social do not make this a normal type scenario moving forward. I am trying to remain a fan.

EOc04wcXmgNAU_xFjf-j4A.text: We attempted a few times to check this place out but we weren't able to find a parking spot. Decided go go during the day on the weekend & had no problem getting in. FYI: you can make reservations on Open Table. It's a free app. We ordered a few drinks and each got a burger. I went with the pb&j burger and added bacon. My boyfriend got the stuffed gorgonzola burger. Both were amazing but be aware, they were both messy, lol. Their fries are really good too. Everything tasted fresh. I would higher recommend both. For drinks I had the salted caramel martini and my boyfriend had the Irish trail. Our bill was $46.47 before tip. Both were good. Definetely would go back.

vPMDOyHny7IhFcIMHW67DQ.text: Great lunch! Yummy, service was awesome! Generous portion and not bad prices! Will return!

QT2xi4DFBV3yKUtN42JIsA.text: Hop Social Tavern is top in customer service! With a large work party and a tight turn around time, manager Brian Sullivan made our dining experience great. They were prompt, courteous, and the food was fantastic! Looking forward to bringing the family in!

cL-vcj7KoYCCd2G6t1sPUg.text: Mixed feelings about Hop Social. Went for the first time a week ago. We were a party of 4 and sat in the bar area because it was very busy as it was a Friday night. The food took quite some time to come out once we ordered but our server made up for it as she kept the drinks coming and provided excellent service overall. The owner David came by our table and checked in on us. He was very nice. He shared the story behind opening the restaurant.   So for the food...I ordered the fried chicken dinner. The chicken and the potatoes were delicious! The cole slaw was terrible. And I love cole slaw so I was a bit disappointed. There was too much dressing (Miracle Whip and not mayonnaise maybe??). My daughter ordered the burger. It was very dry and meat was almost crumbly. Hubby had the Chile Verde nachos. Loaded with meat and very tasty. Huge portion! He loved it. He also liked the huge variety of beers on tap.   Ambiance was nice. Large bar area and 2 different patios if you want to sit outdoors.   Fast forward about a week later. We visited for the 2nd time at 4:30 pm or so on Saturday. It wasn't nearly as busy as our first visit. Plenty of open tables when we were seated. Hubby ordered the fish tacos and enjoyed it. He also had a California roll. Said you could tell it was fresh. I had the fried chicken again although I really wanted to try the pot pie. In hindsight, maybe I should have. My son in law also ordered the fried chicken dinner and my daughter ordered the fried chicken sandwich. We brought our friend who was in from Germany as well and he had some sort of beef sandwich. The fried chicken dinner was disappointing this go around. A bit dry and over cooked. My son in law ended up getting a chicken sandwich in spite of ordering the dinner. The runner had it fixed within a few minutes. Appreciated. However! The service was atrocious! Or should I say lack of service. Again, food coming out was extremely slow. Sara was our server. She rarely checked on us. Never apologized for the slow service. Never filled our drinks until we flagged her down. At one point, we bussed our own table because we were tired of having our dirty dishes on our table so I got up and put them on the table next to us. We never got her attention and most of the time couldn't find her when we needed anything. I'd highly recommend requesting at the time of seating to NOT sit in her section. This visit ran us about $135.   Anyway, the place seems to have pretty decent food for the most part. Expect very slow service in regards to getting your food once you order. I'd highly recommend not going here if you're in a rush. We did learn they offer Happy Hour 7 days a week. Specials seem pretty good. We may try it one more time. Maybe.

SLdVCKENtOPlojK2t6BrdA.text: If you are looking for a spot to hang out for hours uninterrupted this is your spot. But don't expect fast service or food for at least 2 hours. Went here with 4 friends and waited 2 hours for food only to receive raw food.

EeNGja5iVx_XaIVxTfMkUQ.text: After just moving to Chandler we wanted to try some local places and so we went to Hop Social for their happy Hour! Their alcoholic drinks were pretty awesome and such a reasonable price even off the happy house menu. We also split a barbecue chicken flat bread on the happy hour menu, it was pretty good, maybe could've used a little more barbecue sauce, but overall pretty darn good especially for the price! Servers are not overly friendly or efficient, but I think the atmosphere makes of up that. Will definitely be back

DRN6QEd39ZoSHyB0DIifew.text: This place is pretty good. Service is a little slow but I like the food and the happy hour is awesome. They have a ton of beers on tap and I want to try them all. At once. I know I had some good food but I think I had tee many martoonies so there's that. Mahi tacos were very good for sure. Order it all I say.

eYxLSXemM_DhqANZkihtrQ.text: Hop Social Tavern has nice atmosphere. Dimly lit, it is relaxing and comfortable. The portions are generous. My friend and I ordered mussels and they brought us the wrong one, but corrected it pretty quickly and professionally. Appetizer items for happy hour were half off, which was nice.

QNy73oy8TxLX_mbl-wC7HQ.text: Angel is the BEST!!!!  Excellent service. Excellent drinks.  Excellent food.  Excellent ambience.  Try the Christmas infused bourbon!

7ycJT593UicQmUMhlq4eHg.text: Great place, great food, good people! Highly recommend. Sat a party of 9 in 5 minutes. You got to try the donuts omg soooo good! Thanks guys. Keep up the good work.

6Fx6jd6a-QO__dENFrypXg.text: This place is okay. Friendly staff not bad food.  But the bar has three TVs on each side of the bar.  But they have a hanging light in front each tv. Makes it super hard to watch the games that are playing. If they moved the lights a foot and half would have been great.

gZmmuVQortq9Motm1zDSJg.text: My husband and I dine here all the time with our kids. We love this new hipster swank bar/restaurant in the area! It's exactly what chandler needed! The food is delicious especially the grilled steak salad! Our waitress was Rosie and she was fantastic! Very attentive and paid attention to my husband's complaint (they serve the grilled romaine hearts and steak salad with a butter knife...so she made sure that his salad was served with a steak knife on our last visit). We love this place and Rosie!

pNXvWdR4CF2BwiFatIQavQ.text: Five (5) stars () for Angel who was tending bar our first night.  She provided such a great experience I knew we would be back. We have been here twice since discovering this place and I was wishing we had come here the previous night.   I love the ambience here.  It's a relaxed, sorta comfy gathering spot.  Even when I looked around it felt like this is a good place to gather with friends, enjoy some great beers, nosh on some tasty Happy Hour nibbles (these are enough for a meal, especially if you plan to have the donut dessert), relax and unwind.  Ya think the couches contributed to that impression? Anyhoo... The beers are fantastic.  The gluten restriction had to be overlooked once I gazed at the options and tasted my first sample. I could have tasted all of the beers they were serving - you know, if time permitted.  I was just Wowed!  I suppose I was hooked.  Sours, IPAs, Porters, Stouts , Ales, Kolsch, many more and a few aren't on the menu. Happy Hour is 3-6 and their reverse Happy Hour begins at 9:30.  A full HH menu along with drink specials -or special drinks, if you prefer.   Oh, can't forget to mention they do allow *dogs on their patio.   *Please, please, if you do bring you dog, be a responsible pet owner and POTTY your dog in advance.  If dog does have an accident, clean it up promptly and efficiently.  So gross approaching entrance and seeing AND smelling dog poo on sidewalk and in nearby garden. Ya wonder why places don't want pets allowed?  And word to the wise, dogs don't "want to say hello" so keep your pet in check and nobody gets hurt.  Once again I was drawn in by at least one review which caused me to bookmark this place. Glad my hubby suggested we give this place a try.

VaPxcn_wU3mTl67_eDEo1Q.text: If you're looking for a place that is a mixture of hip sports bar, craft beer bar and great pub food, this is the place.  As someone who has worked in the hospitality industry and dined in likely hundreds of different brewpubs in sports bars, I think this one is at that benchmark that the others should aspire to be.  Here are the winners: The craft beer selection isn't the biggest, but I would say it's fairly diverse and very open to those that may not have ever had a craft beer.  If you are looking for a foreign beer, this isn't the place. They do have a few bottles, but 99.9% of the beer they sell is draft beer from the US, with quite a large number from Arizona.  The food: my wife and I got two different burgers from their menu and I will say that the presentation was fantastic but what preceded the burgers was even better. We got their homemade hot fresh donuts as an appetizer. Do yourself a favor, get these and have a nice dark but sweeter style beer with it. I recommend the Dawn of the Red by Ninkasi. The taste of the dough with the cinnamon and the nice crisp outer crust was great but then the warm dipping sauce that they give you just made it fantastic.  As for the burgers, my wife got a bourbon burger and I got a Gorgonzola stuffed burger. Both were cooked perfectly, the burgers tasted very fresh, the buns were exceptional and the fries that accompanied it were not standard shoe string or ribbon fries, they were Oil fries along the lines of those produced by folks like 5 Guys but without an overpowering seasoning.  Something of note for the beer crowd: the draft lines were obviously very clean simply by the way the beer taste in the glass and the glasses were beer clean. Beautiful lacing on all of the glasses, no noticeable odors whatsoever coming off of them and I was extremely impressed with the only exception that you get offered a larger size, a tall, and I was a bit put off by that because of the size of the glass only because I wanted a more traditional style glass for an IPA.  But again, the glass was beautiful, it was clean and it was done right.  Finally, our server, Ashley, was fantastic. Polite, timing could not have been better, nice recommendations, but she wasn't hovering and made us feel welcome even though it was our only our first visit. All the servers were extremely polite and well-dressed but casual in their tops and nice jeans; the place is impeccable down to the cleanliness of the bathrooms and even the glass on the front door.  For those that may not like beer, there is a short wine list but a fantastic cocktail list including handcrafted cocktails. The place is a total win.

8mOXw49OuTgPhpLkgS1NLg.text: Wow!! Amazing service!! Halona was our server and was so sweet and personal! Tiffany was the manager on that evening and delivered a birthday dessert with a personal bday card signed by the staff! As someone in the service industry, this place goes above and beyond!! Not only are they very informed on the beer and food menu, they take the time to get to know their customers and make it a personal experience!!

04Zdej2UF3pNcaOX5LMITg.text: Their menu is definitely versatile. They have everything from calamari to fried chicken. The appetizers are outstanding, but the main courses.... Not so much.  The servers are always pleasant. However, service is painfully slow.

pnoXljQNpzrnYEAUHH-TrA.text: Just ate here for the first time and it was outstanding!  The spicy Mac n cheese was the best ever.  Pear and Gorgonzola salad fantastic.  Service was excellent.  We will be back!

5Yv4UMKGdLvjRLeZWKwdzQ.text: This place was amazing. We sat at the bar, the bartender gave a solid recommendation on food and beer. The staff was very friendly and the service was great. I will definitely come back.

dU9fmyJFd0qu0Nojfu0qzg.text: The beer and food tasted fine. The bar is dirty. Sat outside looking into the bar itself. There were small flies of sorts but couldn't tell if they were from inside or outside. Saw the bartender and waitress pulling several things out from drinks with straws  before serving the drinks to the customers. Saw one waitress scratching something off the ice scoop with her fingers while the bartender watched. They didn't clean the scoop and continued to use it to serve drinks. Bartender seemed to be interested in the waitresses then seeing if we wanted more drinks. Overall it felt like they just didn't care.

XYmoZxk1KQq7oVXnejpp0g.text: This will forever be the place I associate with thinking 'how can you screw-up cheesecake'.  The location is great, the atmosphere is great, reservation keeping is phenomenal, table waiting for us rather than just being prioritized for the next one on arrival, and you're greeted by the friendliest people on the planet.  The wait-staff have long lost their ability to give a f**k. I had no clue this place had a full bar, the waitress never gave us a drinks menu. When clearing the table next to us, the waiter dropped silverware and just kicked it under the table, which was never picked up even when the next people were seated there.  3 times manager-type people stopped by to see how we were doing, the first time, I admit (Dave) I said nothing to you. I should have, my burger was about raw. We did mention it to the next manager type woman that came by who offered to warm it up after she saw what it looked like on the inside, but I declined and just charged on hoping for a good dessert.  Oh boy... dessert, the apple cobbler (I think it was cobbler) was great apparently, which is what my partner got. I got the cheesecake. I don't know how you screw up cheesecake, but they managed to find a way to make it taste like rubber. When manager type #3 (bald man with glasses) asked how dessert was, I replied 'terrible', to which I got the surreal answer "I know right!, let's torch the place! Okay you guys, have a good meal." and then he left.  We won't be back.

hio1kenK78smtJq2KjmqcQ.text: Great food and service..  Medium pricey and it's a very good place for a classy and friendly dinner or happy hour.

PHrlwgLeuijL4r283u8vkA.text: Really good food, atmosphere, and service been there 4 times already and still keep going back!

fkInWTIMrGTIW3BTiBn8ZA.text: Been here a few times and the deconstructed steak salad is unique and delicious. Service was really good considering they just opened a little while ago. My husband loved his dish and we will definitely be back.

BWVfr-UzFI_JHeP5wPV-Pw.text: I've been there 3 times since they've opened. The  Chandler mall area has been lacking exactly this for so long. There are so many chains around the mall with lack luster food and average decor. Not the case with hop social. The restaurant is gorgeous and the food is delicious. Yes, one of the times it took a few more minutes than expected for my husband's beer, but the server was very apologetic and took the beer off the tab. I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews. Everyone I've bought here loves it. We will be back very soon.

b9rVUMbDtZ4sWaVL-SKuUw.text: This place is great. Some poor reviews here and I have no idea why. Great service and the food was good. Big beer selection.

N74S1FyFwLmaaki3QmO-kg.text: Awesome service, great atmosphere (very open, nice patio). Excellent food. We had artichoke dip, French dip (served medium rare) and Ruben! We will be back!

SqQI43xcX7KwLYX3Jf_sEg.text: I've been in a few times. The service has always been prompt and friendly. It's just a beer & wine bar, any outside food is allowed and some local places will deliver. They have some free snacks though!

hWEsj77iyFah9lXEnA8DiA.text: I give this place about 18 months-2 years and then it will burn and fail...great decor , terrible prices!, ok food, decent service, nothing special to set it apart from Bennigans, Chili's, or half a dozen other corporate themed restaurants...too bad as the location is good..it is so sad to see this bland , no personality, nothing unique spot be done over and over again...think: I am form out of town and I ate a place that did nothing to create a memory....that is Hop Social Tavern in a nutshell.

5EuyfgACVBDJwuZ0IyCQnw.text: This place just opened not too long ago and I've already been here twice. Both times our waitress was so friendly and helpful! Even the manager was walking around making sure every guest there was happy. The ambiance is super fun and the food was really good! I also had an awesome beer but can't remember the name of it.

wW5-qNrpBJ8oahEaAb0_PQ.text: Had dinner here for my birthday! Amazing customer service. Great seating area. If you like beer this is a great place for you...there's something like 50 beers on tap. Really great food. Manager brought me an ice cream Sunday! Overall great experience.

rAc9NiinzPoOPOdl0sc1dA.text: Great experience today. I haven't posted a restaurant review in a while but I had to this time. From the being greeted, seated, served and visited by the manager, I really felt like it was their mission that we enjoyed our dinner tonight. Every dish excelled. I went simple with the fish and chips. True beer battered and reminded me of something I had in Australia. Wife had the steak salad, very nice. Little guys mac n cheese was enticing me to steal a bite. This place is highly recommended.

With over 52 beers on tap, there is always a beer for even the most finicky beer drinker. Angel is always on her game and aims to please with fast a friendly service.

9xi-CD6suATfyNk1AVnCmA.text: Another average place for happy hour in Chandler. Nothing really bad but nothing luring me in for a repeat visit either.   I met up with my friends here a few weeks ago and sat out on the large patio. Our server was a nice guy who was happy to put in a food order for our friend who was on her way and put in her drink order the second she arrived so she could take advantage of happy hour too.   We shared the artichoke dip to start, and it had me longing for the stuff they sell at Costco. The fries were slightly better but nothing special. That's all I tried at Hop Social since there aren't many other vegetarian options.   The best part of the evening was the cider I got on draft. It was very tasty, and my friend got an order too after having a sip of mine. I'm not a beer drinker at all so I appreciate that they had 3 ciders on tap. For my second drink, I got their happy hour margarita, and I was less impressed. Stick with the taps!

ITebN5NqYG65LhkcZfqsPQ.text: This place is awesome!! The service is impeccable and the happy hour deal is great! I would definitely recommend coming to this place!

T_EMBS4PLlP7T-wLmKwaAw.text: Sat on patio great choice friendly people great wait staff.  Ordered fried chicken mashed potatoes and super slaw gravy a touch cold but great taste. Other orders at table fish tacos what they came for friends highly recommend they weren't disappointed either had tall Scottsdale Blonde beer love old world taste.   We'll definitely return great waitress.  Beer list is the best.

D5Bu82lCvTQiK7xkiF79og.text: The honeymoon is over.  We've been coming to Hop since it opened and loved everything we ordered:  Cheeseburgers, P/B/J Burger, Chicken Sandwich, Sushi, Pretzels, Salmon, Fish and Chips, Kung Pow Chicken, Pastrami Sandwich, and more.  Hop immediately became our new favorite so we dined here often.  The food was delicious and the portions were huge.  Heaven!   After being away for much of the summer, we came for lunch today.  Wow, have things changed.  No longer is the food piled high on the plate (with the exception of the coleslaw...still plenty of that), nor does it arrive steaming hot.  We ordered fish and chips which used to be a favorite.  Total disappointment.  Rather than the fresh cut pieces of crispy fish they used to serve, the new version includes a small pile of room-temperature fries with three uniformly sliced "circles" of fish (?)  placed on top.  The batter was soggy and flavorless.  At least 1/3 (the perimeter) of the plate was empty and that never used to be the case.    We watched other dishes as they were delivered to nearby tables.  Most looked the same as ours:  Average portion sizes (at best) without the  "wow" factor that used to keep us coming back. We returned our entrees (which management comped) went home and ate lunch.   It seems that Hop, sadly, now serves the same sub par food as most East Valley restaurants and is more focused on cost-cutting than dishing up the high quality and delicious food we used to love.  We'll try it one more time in the hopes that this was a one-off, but that will be it.  Life is too short to eat mediocre food!

JKG3ISDVn0ZGgHN3VRHugg.text: Been here a few times.  This last time was by far the worst.  We decided to sit at the bar.  After waiting for a few minutes for someone to clear off the seats we were sitting at from the previous people, we waited even longer.  A bartender did finally greet us and take our drink order.  She asked us if we wanted tall or short.  We said tall, but she neglected to inform us that size was not on happy hour so we were surprised when the bill came.  The same bartender took our food order.  We ordered an appetizer and the stuffed salmon, then that bartender left for the day.  We received the appetizer, but she never put our food order in.  When we asked another bartender about our main course, he checked and implied it was never ordered in the system.  If we ever go back here again it will be for the food and  we will definitely not sit at the bar.

nC-H9KAza633VS1U7l60JQ.text: The service was ok...food was ok.  We arrived early (about 5pm) to get a table.  Place was not busy with plenty of open seats/tables.  We were seated and were reviewing the menu reviewed the menu looking to order some drinks.  The same girl who sat us sits a huge party next to us that had been in the bar drinking. Extremely noisy where we can't even hear ourselves.  The places is essentially empty, can they spread out the seating a bit...  Our food came, it was ok, warm (not enough fries, had to ask for a bit more).   The manager came over asked how things were and apologized for the noise.    I have been to this place several times and every time there is an issue, noise, service, hair in food.  The server was nice but the people who bring the food and drinks barely say anything.  I know the management won't review this or take any action, so I am done.

9vKJpTneuv2wVP8HTbHSxg.text: This new(ish) place in chandler is usually my fiance and I go to place, unfortunately the most recent experience I had was anything but pleasant. Both my fiance and I ordered burgers, we waited 30+ minutes for these burgers to arrive (which is fine because they were busy). Once we received our food we were quick to eat as we were very hungry. Unfortunately though my fiance's burger was so wet and greasy the bun was soggy and inedible. I ordered a blue cheese stuffed burger, to my dismay when biting into it the burger was plain and contained no cheese inside, the frys that came with it were also cold and hard as a rock, completely inedible. When we brought the attention of it to our waitress she was quick to apologize and get her manager. When the manager Brittney came over she was quick to dismiss the issue and stated the burger was stuffed with cheese when it clearly wasn't. Due to the fact there was issues with both of our expensive burgers we were hoping for a better resolution. Once the bill claim the manager did not even bother to take at least one of the faulty burgers off our tab! Super disappointed with the customer service consider we come here often and usually spend close to $100 every time. We will definitely be taking our money elsewhere.

9DCkcqDF8UjrsuJVxylwgg.text: We have been to this place a few times. The bar is great. But sitting in the restaurant definitely leaves something to desire. Even though their food is truly delicious, unique & diverse. Unfortunately the wait staff is sub par. Both times we came for dinner, each of which were somewhat busy, No wait and empty tables.  On one of the visits, we arrived at about 4:45pm on a Friday for early dinner. The host asked if we thought we would be done by 6:15pm which I thought was odd and strange to ask being that it was fairly empty. Her explanation, that the table she was seating us at had a reservation at that time.   During both dinner visits, being a server in the past I know industry standards on greeting times and revisiting the table. None of which this servers did.   Both visits it took both servers about 5 mins to come and say hi & get our drink order.    On that Friday visit you can see the servers hanging out chatting near the expo / register area. It was amazing to see the lack in the sense of urgency with us literally sitting in front of them. It was extremely difficult to get our female server to ask us if we needed anything.   Lastly, during both dinner visits we experienced a very BAD fruit fly situation.  On the first visit they comped one of the beers because so many flies got trapped in the beer it was pretty gross. We kept swating during both meals too.

9Aem-mZmvjfxYyc4709nKQ.text: 3 strikes you're out! I am continuously bamboozled by this restaurant. I was in the area yesterday and had an hour to waste before a hair appointment, it was perfect timing for a solo Happy Hour date. I'm always either too early or too late to enjoy HH here. So I sit at the bar and cannot even believe the fly infestation at the beer pour station! Super gross! I order a passionfruit spritzer and it's warm.. I am constantly trying new drinks here and constantly let down. Trust me, I am giving HST the benefit of the doubt and they are a let-down over and over again. I order chicken tenders and steak bites which were yummy and the drizzle on the steak bites complements the steak well. I did notice however, while my phone was dead how many people don't "socialize" everyone was on there phone. Employees, managers, bartenders.. It was $30 spent in vain.  The bar was really open, not packed. Lot's of open seats and in the past the wait used to be insane! Hop Social needs a time-out and refresher.

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States

x6Yl2ndtJo0JwwK7qGYKZA.text: We chose this place as the location to meet my best friend and her new beau and couldn't have chosen better. First off, the layout and setup are awesome. The vibe works well for those who are looking for a fun bar vibe (at the bar area), group dining, or for a more quiet area in the back so you can have great conversation.   We met them on a Saturday night and made a reservation. Our server was phenomenal - well versed in the menu, sarcastic and prompt. She let us know when to get our orders in after a large party was sat to ensure that we didn't have to wait too long. She also encouraged us to sample certain beers after asking what type of beers we liked to find new kinds of beers we could like. I tried a beer that tasted great but definitely had a clorox aftertaste (just the way the beer is brewed) and we all had a good laugh about that. We ordered beer and appetizers, all were absolutely delicious. The boys got pretzels and we got the spinach dip.   For dinner, I had the poke, Brittany had the pasta, fiance had the shepherd's pie and Matt had fried chicken.   The food, drinks and desserts were incredible. Atmosphere was great, and service was a 10/10. We would definitely return and can't wait to try more of what they have to offer.

FDyfCyFs9hVDmWR3PHNcCA.text: My boyfriend and I visit Hop Social at least 1-2x a month, and it has quickly become a favorite restaurant of ours. We are greeted quickly, and if there is a wait for a table, they ask for your cell number to text you when a table has opened up. The food is amazing. It's always hot, fresh, and tasty. We love the atmosphere, and the music is always catchy. Last time we were in for dinner, the owner, owner's wife, and manager all came up to us at separate times to introduce themselves and to get to know us. They were going table to table, and it's clear they care about their customers as they were asking for feedback. The bathrooms are always clean and the service is quick. We love the spinach dip appetizer, and I usually get the BBQ chicken pizza. My boyfriend usually gets the ahi tuna bowl.  As long as Hop Social keeps doing things right, we will continue to visit time and time again.

6KHAGas0tt2gtxe6oQWaNQ.text: I have mixed reviews about this place. The first time we visited we had such horrible service.I actually cannot recall the last time I had experienced such terrible service. We were seated at our table around 6pm and it took our server about 20 minutes just to bring us water after we had asked. Once our food was delivered I asked if we could get some ketchup for our fries and she returned 15 minutes later with a tiny amount of sauce. Literally about 2 tbsp of ketchup for two people to share. As I was eating my fries she literally took my plate away while I was chewing my food and didn't even ask if I was finished. Same with our drinks. She grabbed my husbands beer when he had about 1/4 of his beer left. We let her know that he was not finished and she looked annoyed and stormed away.    A month later we decided to try again. Only because the food was so good. Certainly we couldn't have horrible service two visits in a row, right? WRONG! The food was delicious however I don't don't think we will return. Literally just horrible service ever. Such a shame because they really do have a fantastic menu

88vBNHAoE-Co6R2Jf0OTtg.text: The scratch made food is really good and the staff is awesome! I love draft beer and they have tons of it.

ZaFjyo3SDfj_NU-5lWp--w.text: Angel is the bestest everrrrr!! She serves drinks with a pep to her step and an angelic smile. Will be back again and again.

Rf_ffJKZp-CTMIhz68AirQ.text: Wonderful meal, delicious food, great service- such a pleasant experience - can't wait until we get a chance to come and try other things on the menu. Flavorful sauces, "homemade" goodness, and quality ingredients. Meals are not "pre-made", trucked in frozen and set under a warmer. Meal set Hop Social apart from all the other local beer brewery/tavern places. I had the steak tips in a delicious sauce. I recommend this specialty! We also had the Chicken Pot Pie - absolutely out of this world!!

DGhNbvOT5TLr6Oy2D7aNNA.text: We love this place... great selection of beer, the food is fantastic, the atmosphere is friendly with very good service, and the pricing is just right. We bring guests here all the time since they've opened because it's unique, casual, and the food is yummy.

vOSnw68KwgxuVcDBMli-uA.text: I'm a big fan of this place; it's a welcome addition to the neighborhood.  Quality food, excellent beer selection, and hip vibe.

GfsLA1U9mvNED4IAVgKanA.text: Had lunch. Very good food. Buttermilk fried chicken was tasty, a tiny bit too much salt but crispy & chicken moist. The hamburger was very good. Absolutely order the corn fritter appetizer: DIVINE! Pleasant staff

The food and service has always been excellent for us. I love how the owners make a point to stop at each table. I highly recommend the fried chicken or spicy Mac and cheese.

eZNG96Oom_j3JcdKT0_VSA.text: Definitely worth the drive to the East Valley. I recommend sitting near the kitchen where you can see the dishes coming out. The service was very good. Our table tried the pretzel and cheese dip as an appetizer. The cheese sauce was amazing. For dinner we shared the Cuban pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw. The pork was perfectly cooked with lots of flavor. The coleslaw was very crunchy and very tasty. We also ordered the Thai prawn linguine which was delicious as well. We were treated to a banana berry Sunday, great way to end the meal. There's something for everyone on the menu. The portions are perfect for sharing. Looking forward to returning and trying something different. Hope they open a location in the West Valley soon.

Cn2vL8-lH5N6yHqsok-H7Q.text: What a beautiful place. The service is awesome.the bartender was super attention give and sweet. Lots of beers to choose from and a big menu. My friend and I just had a few appetizers that were delicious. I can't wait to come back and try it for happy hour!!

0exKijOIawXTnjRkYGxCcg.text: This place has lots of craft beers on tap and a well priced happy hour.  Make sure you sit in the bar area for the happy hour deals.

2QUyZvIu7rF_FqAbNXNqMQ.text: What great place for beer lovers. They've only been open less than two weeks, but they are doing it right. The food menu looks amazing. Can't wait to do lunch or dinner. ...with a beer of course.

BoCQETepMGqAOtUKZlDuXw.text: Nice ambiance.  We went for lunch and ordered a French dip and the buttermilk chicken dinner.  While the coleslaw was delicious, the chicken tended to be too salty.   My husband was excited about the French dip, as it was stuffed FULL of roast beef.   However both the sandwich and the au jus were too salty for him also - which is surprising as my husband likes more salt on his food.   It's too bad - the restaurant was super clean, music was not too loud (it seems to be a bit of a sports bar atmosphere).  I wish they could tone down the salt!!!

U9eb0tiHJOgIExOdkNUvyQ.text: A little pricey outside of happy hour, but happy to have another local spot with good beer selection and decent food. Huge upgrade from the elephant bar in my opinion

Muaue8XNMHHsGCFbn6JrQg.text: Amazing service. Angel, the bartender is great, Ty the busser on point and Brittany the manager a sweetheart. Amazing happy hour food and prices, but hands down the best service we've had in a longtime! Def coming back soon. Thank you all.

PrO9Af7iT0quv7GbnFnNiw.text: Great food had the appetizer chicken strips and was soo good! And big portion! We had a large party that accommodated us. Great service and atmosphere

xzULpkC0ZhzVQb67aANEjA.text: Had the fish and chips, the best part of the meal was the chips. Fish is frozen... enough said if you like eating rubbery fish that has been fried you will LOVE this meal if you enjoy tasting your food skip this version of fish and chips.

SHV5LIT5sBB46bYacmBnQg.text: The first time I came with my girlfriend it was nice. We sat on patio and food was great, and service and our waitress were good. This time I came with my husband and we sat inside and our server, a male, was rude, messed up our order and made it seem like our fault. 9lGQsDe27LuBnCl2GNUqig.text: We have had only good experiences here--until tonight. We called in an order for pick up (rather than bring our 2 year old in). The woman on the phone wrote down our orders--she said she had to enter them into the computer after. She repeated back the correct order. But when we got home with our order, they left a dish completely off. We hadn't realized it when we paid, which is our mistake. But imagine our disappointment when we got home and I didn't have a dinner.  They need a better system for to-go orders--or don't bother taking them

uDEkhKPvLVwsF_gQ0hT7GA.text: Came here tonight at the recommendation of a foodie friend --- wow!  Seriously delicious. Shares the grilled salmon with my Love and it was amazing. Nice flavor and perfectly cooked. Mashed potatoes rocked.   Highly recommended

mciDO66VOvHnR-X4cTgunw.text: Just found this place driving by and decided to try it. Fantastic!! 52+ craft beers and (my personal favorite part) 3 ciders! And thank goodness none of the ciders was that horrible Angry Orchard every other place carries. I had the Desert Dragon cider - very good. We had the donut appetizer (non traditional, but how can you turn down fresh, hot cinnamon donuts with caramel sauce?) Yum! I had the buttermilk fried chicken, which is deboned, so it has the flavor of bone-in, but is much easier to eat. We all enjoyed our meals and agreed we'd be back soon. Our server, Erika, was also fabulous: super friendly, super helpful. It was a terrific evening!

tb_QogpJO3CoS9sOciR_AA.text: Great new place in Chandler! Excellent made from scratch food nothing ever frozen. Tons of craft beers on tap with an everyday happy hour. Service was on par and menu had a great variety of American style food thats very fresh. Ask for Avery or Beau for your waiters they were GREAT!

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States. Love this new restaurant! Great food, service and an awesome selection of craft beers. This place is going to do very well.

DK6orhCRtIPTHmpRoLV-6w.text: We were really pleasantly surprised by Hop Social. We stopped by during Happy Hour on a whim before going to a movie at the nearby theatre. I had visited the building previously when it was still Elephant bar and was curious to see what it looked like now. The place looks completely different now. At first, I was worried that we would be late as the place was rather crowded. That wasn't the case at all. We were informed the Happy Hour menu was only available at the bar and on the patio, so we sat on the patio. The set-up out there is really nice. Large shades block the view of the parking lot and the cushion seats and high top tables create a really welcoming environment. The misters helped with the spring heat. We were promptly greeted and ordered our beers. The beer menu is fantastic and I was able to get one of my all time favorites from a smaller brewery (Tower Station IPA from Mother Road Brewery in Flagstaff). We ordered three different dishes from the Happy Hour menu - the fish tacos, Kung Pao lettuce cups and the steak dish. Everything was brought out really quickly despite how busy they were. We were able to get a really decently sized dinner out of these three dishes as the items on the Happy Hour menu are full-sized.  Overall, we really enjoyed Hop Social. We were able to get four beers and three dishes for under $40. We will definitely be back.

-DoV24XDYZMm-LV0mbiw4Q.text: Amazing experience. David, the owner, introduced himself to us and made sure we were comfortable. Loved all of the draft beer options. This was my third time getting the steak tacos and they're delicious.

tre4sfnqENLrrub2uGJ2jQ.text: Great beer selection, reasonably priced. Good atmosphere. Next time i'm trying the food. I'll be back!

_qOdoZ9TqWljYn5hTn_pRg.text: One of my favorite places. For many reasons. It has a great patio, the sporty bar is nice for sitting at if you're a single gal looking for a quick bite,  and it's swanky enough you can bring the out of town guests for a really nice dinner in their dining room. Not many places that can say they are ALL of these things. Angel, who bartends evenings, is amazing. I went in by myself the other night and asked for a menu after spending the day at the hospital with my husband, she looked at me and said, 'get the beef tips, you won't regret it'. I did and I will order them again! Talk about nice reasonably priced comfort food. Very tasty, beef tips in a Cabernet sauce, flash fried onion strings, garlic mashed potatoes and perfectly prepared asparagus. Nice wine selection and loads of beers on tap as well as cocktails. Everyone is polite, excellent cross section of clientele, from business people to those looking to grab a beer and watch the game and those who want a little nosh on the patio. Great happy hour too! You can't beat this place!

OB6bL7Um7qlEuVtTwy4o9g.text: Pretty great place! Loved the atmosphere. Our server was very nice and helpful. The kids loved their food as did my husband. I tried his fried chicken sandwich and wow was it good. The gravy that is served with it is amazing, I could literally drink it by itself. My dish was mediocre at best. I had the blackened chicken feta pasta dish. The server did say it was a tad spicy. I don't like spicy food so she recommended plain chicken breast. I got the dish and there was hardly any sauce. What I was tasting was very bland and honestly boring. I asked for more sauce and they accommodated. The sauce was wine based so that was the consistency. It was very light in flavor which explains why the dish is bland. Would I order it again, no but the food I saw at other tables looked amazing. If you are looking for a light dish then this is the one for you however. The server took my dish off the bill without us asking her too. That was greatly appreciated. We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States

akhTRKUaO6Coq_E5UdqRGQ.text: I came here for dinner with a friend to try something new in the Chandler area. Hop Social definitely has an inviting and unique look unlike most restaurants in the area. Their menu had so much to offer, even for a vegetarian like me. Our waitress, Erika, was one of the most personable and welcoming servers I've had in my dining experience. She was so accommodating and very honest in her opinions of the food and drinks they serve. Our food came out in an impressive amount of time and tasted delicious. From the customer service, their staff, and overall atmosphere, I can confidently say I will back for some good eats and drinks from Hop Social!

kxHs1lC75gEjPwcoxPue7w.text: Bartender Angel.. first off she's beautiful, she's very attentive, she's a very happy entertaining bartender! She's the best!!!!!!! She accommodates her customers.. whenever I go to hop social, and I don't know what to drink she'll make something and it's always perfection!!!! ANGEL!!! Best bartender there, ask for her! If hop social let her go I wouldn't even go back as much as I LOVE their food Hahahaha!

cczU3IpP0SCpJmhAxY2BRg.text: This is a great place.  The food is fantastic and the service is awesome.  The 3 times I've been there, the music absolutely consumes the patio making it hard to visit and really takes away from any ambiance that we love in similar patio restaurants. I also noticed the crowd is a little more mature, like me, and would likely appreciate music that is all age friendly.   Each time we've visited we have asked that the music is turned down it is so obnoxiously loud.  We are happy to have this as an option and will go back   Hoping they take the music request to heart.

ISrJpmWOrGeI16aDFZnqjg.text: We went after work with a table of 8.  The service varied from attentive to absent but she also had three other large tables on the go.  Everyone enjoyed their food...we would have drank a lot more (and tipped a lot more) had the server been more focused on follow up.  Overall, the renovations look great, the food and beer was awesome and with some time, I'm sure the service will improve too.

Hj_H33JZfJAPQUFKJnpGwA.text: our server Erica A was great! drinks are good, food is good, my 3 y/o said the mac & cheese was YUM! definitely will come back again.  protip: try the alcohol, it's delicious!

TzY9CTeoa6RO2xf9q6peEw.text: This establishment is absolutely incredible! Legitimately chose my apartment complex due to this place. I live next door. I'm from Oregon and love the fact they are Oregon beer focused. If it wasn't for my experience with Levi and Angle both (bartenders) I would have never fell in love with this place. Angle delivers an extraordinary experience from a bartender. Makes you feel at home, apart of the business, and just over all makes you feel like apart of the family. You will leave here already planning your next visit, trust me!

2Cej5weNGxdmGiPdpii8Vg.text: I really had high hopes for this place but they failed at every turn. Whether it be food, drinks or most importantly service. Sadly of all things you would think a place like this would want you to drink and have a good time but apparently they enforce 4 drink maximum regardless of how long you have been there. Well at least this rules applies to folks who are of any ethnic background, (the folks next to us were on their 3rd drink that hour and had been there since 6 pm, it was 9 pm when I asked them).I wouldn't go as far as to say this place discriminates because they did hire a 4 ft 2 inch ginger only a mother can love as a manager. But I will say stay clear of this place if you plan on having a good night or want a decent meal. It is very out of character for me to leave a bad review or complain at the end of the day it's a business and it feeds many mouths. But this place is True disappointment.

p36LaRsJ8OJqpmcdLCeSzQ.text: Folks say that 3rd times a charm. Ummmm... not so much in this case. I went to dinner with 4 of my girlfriends and came to Hop Social. We don't get to have dinner with each other often so it's a big deal when we select a place where we can enjoy food, sippy sips and catch up. One GF called for reservations earlier but was informed that we should be ok for a group of 5 to eat dinner at 6 and should be able to get in with no problem.  We actually arrived 15 min early only to find out that they were not seating any more people at tables bc the kitchen was backed up. (There were empty available tables so it was clear no one was being seated.) We were told it would be 45 min, maybe less, to wait for a table. We waited about 15 min and were seated in the patio.  We ordered a round of drinks and 2 appetizers-- pretzel bread and artichoke dip. Drinks and water came out fairly timely. We ordered our meals-- veggie burger, blackened chicken pasta, medium burger with pepper jack, bison burger, fried chicken and 1 to-go order of pot pie. Appetizers took 45 min to arrive.  After 1.5 hrs, another  GF gets a call on her cell and it was the hostess calling to tell us our table was ready.  She informed them that we were already seated in the patio for the last 1.5 hrs.   Our food finally arrives almost 2 hours later. Our medium burgers were rare, veggie burger was cold, fried chicken was raw and actually our GF who ordered the pasta liked it. We did order drinks in between while waiting for the main dinner. As time went on we got hungrier and angrier.  We watched food delivered to different tables but they were the wrong tables. Servers and managers running around not knowing where orders belonged.   Fast forward to a Manager-In-Training (blonde) who came to our table to check on how things were going. We were very honest and told her exactly how it went... "not a good experience at all". We shared how long everything took and she firmly tried to correct us on timing. We shared the exact timing of when we got there, what we ordered, and how long it took. She begged to differ. Word of advice, Manager-In-Training, when you approach a table and ask for feedback, be prepared for honesty. You may not always like it but you have to own up to a sh@t show when it happens. Also, when things aren't going great, do your best to turn it around. Do not throw your employees under the bus like you did our waitress. Own it bc you have the power to take a crappy situation, turn it around and make things better.  Instead you came across rude with an attitude and defensive. And, yes you offered us dessert but your "attempt" was not genuine and all we wanted was out. You def need more training bc you are not ready.   As for our waitress, Halona, if you are reading this, we want you to know that the table of 5 ladies you had tonight appreciate you! We applaud you! You held yourself together in the middle of chaos surrounding you. You kept your cool. Your remained attentive and sweet. You apologized oh-so-many-times. We are sorry you were caught in the crossfires which is why we made sure you knew how we felt about you in person and now on yelp. Keep your head up and we wish you better days bc you worked your tail off tonight. Thank you. Thank you for your kind and genuine nature.   To the other manager (short dark hair)... thank you for coming to our table and genuinely caring. You came at the height of aggravation You listened to us. You felt us. You apologized. Thank you for handling it the appropriate way. Thank you for picking up the food tab.   I am a frequent customer to Hop Social. I'm unsure as to what is happening as far as it declining bc this would be my go-to place to meet people for work meetings, lunch, dinner and happy hour. This is my 3rd visit in a row in which service has been a huge disappointment. The first disappointment was when the restaurant had all these fruit flies all over the restaurant. I had set up a lunch meeting with my coworkers and it had not only been distracting but obviously unappetizing.   During my next visit, I met a GF for dinner. Somehow my food was mixed up (beet salad) and made incorrectly. My GF's order was fine and she got to eat while I waited an additional 30 min for you to correct it. She was pretty much done with her food.   So for me to still come tonight after the other 2 experiences is proof that I still believed in this restaurant. After tonight, I will never come back. I will not set up another meeting with anyone. I will not come back to enjoy lunch or dinner with a loved one. I will not even come in to order a glass of water bc that's how awful our experience was tonight.   It's very sad bc this place was once a fun favorite of mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States. Raw fried chicken

9J6dEP8zPPmbG-63pAbfGg.text: My boyfriend and I LOVE this place! I have yet to have something on the menu I didn't like! The nachos, steaks, and happy hour menu are all really good. We always sit at the bar and have had service from both Shelby and Angel who are lovely. Angel made me a super good pear martini, but all of the cocktails we've had have been very good as well.

jgvJtvWeWDIc3atkq19WCw.text: Visiting to AZ right now and stopped by to grab a bite to eat at the bar. The service was amazing,  the bartender and staff were incredibly friendly,  service was incredible.   (My bartender's name was Angel btw) So ask for her!

bcBFCBmICvqSDOGi86UUyQ.text: This is my third visit. I was the lucky recipient of a very generous gift card, so we decided to try it out.  The first and second visits had good food and stellar service.  Today, we had amazing service from our friendly bartender, Angel. Also with a recommendation to try the steak tips. *cue angels singing* It's been quite a while since I had a plate of food that good in a restaurant.  The onion rings were separated, well-salted, and crispy. The buttermilk mashed were a solid pairing. But, the steak tips and mushrooms were absolute Nirvana. The right proportion, seasoning and bite.  Please try these when you come in next. I'm betting you'll be glad you did.

oe35Rbd3pBnA0AuzVGFjpw.text: Love love love love it here!!! Seriously the best service, best brews, best foods!  I feel like I could not say enough to express...so just go, try it out!  We have been here twice already:  The soft pretzels are dlish, the artichoke/spinach/cheese dip is rich and creamy, chili Verde nachos were decent. The meat was so good, tender and full of flavor....a little too many chips, proportionately a little off.  Hubby enjoyed the cabernet tenderloin tips. I tried the sauce it was so rich and tasty. I had the stuffed gorgonzola burger yum! Cooked perfectly! Had the beer flight and everyone I tried was awesome! Can't wait for our next visit

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States

kmxC74eJjzUfNsZgoTh31w.text: Last night's dinner, I dropped into this great local watering hole near my hotel. The atmosphere was casual and lively. Bar top tables and couch type seating makes this place great for groups. Music pumps throughout the restaurant that helps jive up this place.  I had their Chicken Tortilla soup and a house favorite, Chicken Marsala. A+ combo. The soup was thick and flavorful. Their Chicken Marsala was as good or better than Cheesecake Factory's version. With fresh mushrooms and a house made mashed potato, you can't go wrong. Certainly, worth a visit if you're in the Chandler area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States

2XNSvtjzpBFjcHo3JSEkGA.text: I, along with a few of my friends, visited Hop Social evening of May 8. The purpose was to enjoy happy hour and celebrate my girlfriend's birthday.  One of my friend and I were seated.  As we waited, not one server greeted us or offered us water. We waited there for several minutes. When somebody did approach our table it was the hostess telling us we had been inadvertently sat at tables that were reserved and kindly asked if we could move to the tables immediately behind us. Of course we moved; not a problem. But we continued to sit there with no server; still no water offered, or anyone asking if we were waiting for more in our party. Finally, about 10 to 15 minutes into our musical chairs sitting , we had to flag down the hostess again stating that we had not been serviced.  She agreed to get us some water.  She then must have gotten our server who then came to our table and seemed surprised even though he could have clearly seen us in his section.   The service was still poor after that.  One ordered an appetizer at the same time I did; I got mine and she chalked it up to "it'll be out soon".  She finally had to ask our server about her order.  He didn't write it down.  Another GF & her daughter orders an appetizer of chips and dip (can't recall if it were spinach or artichoke).  It was cold.  They asked someone else, not our server but someone checking on the table, to get a warmer order as this wasn't very warm at all.    Overall, the food is good at Hop Social and the cocktail selection as great; the service is definitely to be desired.  I was very disappointed.

ln5w-P1jOsaTn6lfj1HSjA.text: Had another great bison burger here on Saturday. I loved the coleslaw that my food came with too.  We got a cookie desert too and it was fantastic.  We will be back again.

8yA8rIUFU2luymGdjhEj5g.text: Went here for happy hour with some friends and had a good time. I am a big fan of diverse and mostly unknown beers, so this place suited my tastes nicely. They have 50+ beers on draft, but I stuck mostly to my porter/stouts. They also have some chocolatey ones, but these were a bit too sweet for me.  The overall atmosphere was casual and a great choice for having a few drinks with friends. They also serve food/appetizers. I didn't order any, but from what I saw from others, they looked tastey!

eRtLg6j_9yykgr4Es-B30w.text: The staff awesome. Aly was our primary caretaker and she is fantastic. Several others came by to drop off tasty food items like these buttery pretzel bread sticks. We were a party of four but I hardly noticed what everyone was eating because my Thai prawn linguini had my full attention. Excellent experience.   Eating area does develop a din after the post work crowd arrives.

7n9ZNYn_MWGA126bqEn0RA.text: Awesome spot , the social bleeds through the bartender, Angel. Great experience, great food, and a great bar for sports. Had the Cabernet Sirloin Tips (At Angels recommendation) was the best decision of my night aside from coming to joint in the first place. Will for sure be back on my travels, I highly recommend the same for anyone else reading this review. Sit at the bar and say hi to Angel

QIwetJrOeqkE3JTW_THuKA.text: Came in for happy hour and small plates. Trevor was AMAZING! The food was delicious and delivered quickly. Even had a few requests and Trevor remembered them 100%. I couldn't have asked for a better date night. I ordered the drink with spicy passion fruit not realizing it was jalapeno (I'm not a native to Arizona) and Trevor took care of that too. I never even wanted it taken off because it was my fault. Seriously the best. Thank you!

4EbI2BZ4pl_xGEIZ7hh36Q.text: My husband and I stopped in one morning for a Bloody Mary before we went shopping for my birthday. My husband told the bartender it was my birthday after he had asked us what we were up to. About 10 minutes later the bartender brought over a birthday treat and a card that everyone working had signed. It was so sweet and very appreciated. Thanks, guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States

T6dqn2wymEoGLSp3rLxvJQ.text: Awful internet. They give you a password but only a few people at a time can be on it. Don't come here if you plan on being productive. Also the wait staff didn't know much about the food and how it was prepared.

j4MWEwR0JViHsyVnHX77PA.text: Angel is the BEST person there!! She always helps us and is so sweet!! She is on top of our drinks and always remembers our names and drinks  my friends and i always come here for her! You won't regret coming here to see Angel!

yVYXpY7CvC20FIng9bN-UA.text: Cool spot next to Chandler Galleria. So many great beers on tap but I was having a work dinner and had to resist the temptation. Bah hum bug. Coworker and I both had salads which we enjoyed thoroughly.  Kale salad was a great light option. My only gripe would be the chicken breast which I barely touched because it was dry and rubbery.  Tasted liked it was a frozen breast that has been cooked earlier and then reheated. I wasn't very hungry so it wasn't the end of the world.   Service was on point.  The waitresses did seem a little annoyed with us because we weren't ready to order the multiple times they checked up on us, but at least they kept coming back and didn't give up on us.  I can appreciate that. Would come back here to try more menu items.  Saw many orders of donuts go to tables so it must be a thing.

W1oE31dpduJm4NiDx5N1qA.text: This place was great! I'm not sure I've had Margherita pizza as good as the one I found here, and that says a lot. The sauce had a sweet hint to it and the crust was perfection. Everyone in our group was excited about their meal, and the diversity of options is bound to offer something for everyone.   You may notice upon first review of the menu that they offer donuts as as appetizer. Do it. Get the donuts.   Great beer and other alcohol selections and the vibe and staff are also upbeat and fun. I just wondered what it would take to get a set of couches like they have in there... so cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lots of beer on tap!
Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States. Yes, you can have these amazing donuts with Carmel sauce for an appetizer. Smells like the state fair 3
Photo of Hop Social Tavern - Chandler, AZ, United States. The classic French Dip is extra meaty, your choice is side salad, slaw or fries.

ZG2H9uEhpaSUH2vTlHTCoQ.text: Good food, great selection of beer, and a cool environment. Service is kind of hit or miss, but it's great for after work appetizers and drinks or lunch. It's pretty loud inside... too loud to hold a good conversation... so I always go for a spot on the patio if there is room.

2N4-F94OGgeIsEu79dFm0w.text: I like this spot for happy hour. They have a pretty expansive happy hour menu especially in terms of food; however I think they should add a couple happy hour cocktails as alternatives to the margarita. I also wish they made the margarita with fresh juice. Those are the kinds of touches that would really elevate this place. I think they need to do a new menu as well as improve upon dishes that they keep around. Almost everything I've had here could use just a tiny flavor boost, garnish or sauce to really sell me on the item. They need to add items that people really crave.  Sweet potato fries and a dipping sauce like delux burger (similar to cane's sauce) would probably have me here a few times a week. The beer cheese soup is delish. Add a pretzel stick on the side. The neon sign is weird...

xdGW3G9yaac8jwLrHm4E_A.text: Told 5 minutes for the wait, actual wait was 35 minutes. The California Roll was really good, or main courses were good. Only giving two stars because we were attacked by fruit flies as soon as we sat down. We mentioned it to the server and it seemed to ignored. 20 minutes later we finally asked another employee if we could move and our request was granted. Of course we got to a new table and the fruit flies were there as well. The manager comped us a desert. There is obviously a problem with fruit flies that needs to be addressed.

pJVninmHKka89Nv6vwuL1w.text: Walked in just wanting a brew to relax and have a chat with my son.  30 minute wait is expected for a Friday night. Place is moving, we squeeze in at the bar in under 5 minutes of arrival. With all the hot plates moving pay us we decided on the social pizza along with the fried chicken plate.  Man! We threw it back it with a moon juice and a 10 ipa. The place was excellent and we will be returning.

9-gv13Vwwff9I2dBANYPoQ.text: Most disappointed ... I was really hoping for a great experience. My Wife and I sat on the front patio and were served by a less than excited employee. Food was very bland which I didn't finish. While finishing our drinks I noticed something over the wife's shoulder on the wall behind her seat. To not alarm her, I asked her to stand and move to the other side of the patio. She never listens to me but this time she sees I'm not messing with her and follows my instruction. There was a very large roach just a few inches away from her. When we alerted the staff of this they acted as if it was happens often. We won't be back and strongly suggest the same for you.   Tom

LWr12QT0_ccXGQScBVcNdw.text: This place is awesome. Second time here. Had a variety of things to eat. All were wonderful. We made a reservation on a Friday night when there was an hour wait and were seated immediately when we arrived. Our server greeted us with a free app, the manager stopped by during the meal, the beer list is impressive. This may be our new favorite spot!

C8M9NyPz6LDyMooq_Xjmew.text: This is my second trip to Hop Social. The first time I had the pot pie which was fabulous. This time I wanted something more healthy so I ordered the veggie burger. It was just wonderful! I have to say I don't order veggie burgers often, but if they were all like this one, I'd order them all the time. My husband had the fish and chips and had no complaints. Don't know why we waited so long to return, but rest assured we'll be back much more frequently from now on!

KiP_cAATmEHaUZHxUfvFUA.text: First time here and the service is absolutely amazing and beautiful the food is exactly the owner came and greeted us made sure we were well taken care of!!!!!  The Coziness of the restaurant is fantastic!!!  We will be returning

4TLwYV8dNvJIQDu8Y1oKEw.text: Hi;  Food was decent; not blow me out of the water. Thought the experience of booking on "yelp": then being told because we booked only a half hour prior we wouldn't be seated: (felt the entitlement of our head hostess can cool off) started the experience. Observing the wait staff buss their own tables (hop social culture); made the poor waiter; not be able to connect; have timely deliveries; and further socialize.  Weird experience to a local bar dressed up.

IGxg_c6UGoUlqNp-gZk7Xw.text: Fantastic service, incredible food, awesome happy hour food/prices and great atmosphere! This place never disappoints and this is our favorite go-to hangout! Highly recommend!

_dAokOEoIT6gbyc7qLVWdA.text: Friendly staff. Great food. The fish tacos. Pretzels and the steak bites were excellent. Go for happy hour!

2ScoTfOX2vIrrVZgUGqpLg.text: If you're looking for a chill night i'd recommend this place. Looks pretty fancy on the inside.

jv-D5lo0o_SoVpq79dB4QQ.text: Fisrt time here - came later 8:45 - for dinner hoping there wasn't a wait. Seated right away - friendly service - good food & drink - cool vibe -  we"ll be back!

td1eOo_rQJAmfV0Voat7pg.text: Our server was very unfriendly and got our order wrong. When the order finally came 15 minutes later it was under cooked. Disappointing. Would not recommend.

TemeUh3ybZzK8UVO8C6pxg.text: Love this place! Have been to it, two or three times in the last month and a half and the service is awesome. The food is outstanding and the owners/manager are always walking around and making sure everything is going Ok.  Oh... and the donuts are to die for!

04CpQjpSb0Icl-_LVEzcGw.text: Great new local spot!! Everything was delicious! I recommend the meatloaf and the dnuts.

7qzuS9uXI3qP0s8R8GP8yw.text: Great atmosphere and great beer. Food took forever (35-40 min on a Sunday afternoon around 1:30) and is overpriced- my $13 strawberry pear chicken salad had very little chicken and should have been $10 at most. Hubby's BBQ burger was okay but not really anything special. Great place for appetizers and drinks or just drinks. Pastas / other specialties sounded good but I see those more as dinner options (especially at those prices), can't imagine the wait time to get your food during dinner rush.

gXGkfIvakw-Zxo5ntW5ixQ.text: Great food and drinks but do not go there if you have a large party.    They have this extremely stupid system where they don't submit the whole tables orders at the same time.    We had 16 and there was a 45 minute span when our food arrived.     The table next to us with 8 had a 20 minute span.   We will probably return with only 2-4 people.

Hj9rW6kHdDn1_RSeP3l_FA.text: I went for dinner on Friday night with friends. Obviously a lot of beer options which is fun since you can do flights.  We all shared food and ordered the nachos, truffle pizza, brussels sprouts, poke tower and homemade vanilla doughnuts all were very tasty. It was a fun atmosphere and very friendly service. I look forward to coming back soon.

qib8KifDSQCJdswdddkklQ.text: I love this place! We went for a work Christmas party, we're a big bunch and we like to drink and eat. All of the food was awesome, their PB and J burger was bomb and the service was impeccable! They handle the rowdy bunch like a champ!!

an46KyhigLdW7oEEQsLz9A.text: Attractive restaurant in the old Elephant Grill facility. They have 52 craft beers on tap but it's odd they have don't have prices listed. Happy hour which is just ok on drink specials is $1.00 off each beer...but it's a $1.00 off what? They have just two wines for Happy Hour. Service is not so great...saw our server once and we had to ask another server to take our order. So many choices in the area...not sure if we will come back..

yvEbx7Xw6oOZAWTgxkPgXw.text: Amazing food, awesome service and atmosphere. Happy hour is a great price for the quality and quantity of food. The wife and I also split the French dip sandwich for dinner, it was awesome served as two meals just the sandwich was split.   Angel at the bar is extremely nice along with everyone else.

EZw3SxR9uWwDHjCbqmjDHA.text: Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Had an amazing mushroom pizza last time we were here. The only complaint came from the kid who doesn't like mayo
